name: Loggerhead Shrike
overview: The Loggerhead Shrike prefers to sit on low, exposed perches to easily search for rodents, lizards, birds, and insects. They eat small prey but are known for impaling larger prey on thorns or barbed wire for later consumption. While flying, this bird uses very rapid wing beats, it often observed hovering. They do not migrate and are of least concern.
habitat: The Loggerhead Shrike prefers the open country with sparse trees and shrubs. They may also be seen in large openings of wooded habitats as well as short habitats without trees.
